com.ti.debug.engine.scripting

Class MemoryMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.MemoryMap

  • public class MemoryMap
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves as a encapsulates the memory map methods. An instance of this class is automatically created when a new session is opened.

    // Create Environment and open a debug session
    ScriptingEnvironment env = new ScriptingEnvironment();
    DebugServer myServer = (DebugServer) env.getServer("DebugServer.1");
    DebugSession mySession = myServer.openSession("*", "*");

    ...

    // Create a memory Map
    mySession.memory.map.reset();
    mySession.memory.map.add(0x100, Memory.Page.DATA, 0xFF, true, true);
    mySession.memory.map.enable();

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Add read or write permission for a range of target memory to the memory map.

      Toggle memory mapping on or off in the debugger server.
      void remove(long nAddress, int nPage)
      This function deletes a range of memory from the memory map.
      void reset()
      This function resets the memory map by making all memory non-readable and non-writeable.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(long nAddress,
                int nPage,
                long nLength,
                boolean bReadable,
                boolean bWritable)
         throws ScriptingException
        Add read or write permission for a range of target memory to the memory map. If the range overlaps an existing entry, the attributes of the new range take precedence in the memory map.
        Parameters:
        nAddress - is the starting address of a range in memory.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        nLength - defines the length of the range.
        bReadable - set to true to make this range readable. A memory range can be readable, writable or both.
        bWritable - set to true to make this range writable. A memory range can be readable, writable or both.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • enable

        public void enable(boolean bMapOn)
            throws ScriptingException
        Toggle memory mapping on or off in the debugger server.
        Parameters:
        bMapOn - pass true to turn memory mapping on, pass false to turn memory mapping off. Default value is true.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • remove

        public void remove(long nAddress,
                   int nPage)
            throws ScriptingException
        This function deletes a range of memory from the memory map. If you attempt to access a memory location that is not readable, the debugger will instead return the default value. Although you specify a specific memory address as a parameter to this function, the entire range in which the specified memory address is located is deleted from the memory map. For example, if you have a range of (0x000 - 0x1007), specifying any address in that range will cause MemoryMap.delete() to remove the whole range from the current memory map.
        Parameters:
        nAddress - identifies an address with a memory range already defined in the memory map.
        nPage - the memory page. Use one of Memory.Page enumeration.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws ScriptingException
        This function resets the memory map by making all memory non-readable and non-writeable. If you attempt to access a memory location that is not readable, the debugger will instead return the default value.
        Throws:
        ScriptingException
